conclusion: Problem involves understanding how shadows A, B, C, and D change when light source moves to front right.
Four objects on a wooden floor casting shadows labeled A, B, C, and D.
Light source is above objects and moving to the front right.
Need to determine how shadows change in position and size.
Understanding lighting and shadows: light source above objects casts shadows on the floor.
Direction of light affects direction and length of shadows.
If light moves to front right, shadows should shift accordingly.
If light is directly above, shadow is directly below; if light moves to front right, shadow moves to back left.
If light moves away from objects, shadows might become smaller.
If light source moves farther away, shadows become sharper but smaller.
Shadow's size and position depend on light source position, object height, and distance from light source.
Formula: shadow size is proportional to object height times distance from object to screen, divided by distance from light source to screen.
Screen is the floor, light source is above.
In photography, when sun moves, shadows change direction and length.
Shadow's position can be determined by similar triangles.
If light moves to front right, shadow should move to back left.
